conclusion: Understanding motional EMF in a magnetic field using the formula ε = B · L · v.
The rod is straight and moves perpendicular to the magnetic field.
The induced EMF is ε = B · L · v for the straight rod.
The rod is bent into two equal-length segments, each perpendicular to the other.
The rod moves at an angle of 45 degrees relative to each segment.
The velocity component perpendicular to each segment is v · cos(45°) = v · √2/2.
The effective length contributing to the EMF for each segment is L/2.
The EMF for each segment is ε'_segment = B · (L/2) · v · √2/2.
The total induced EMF for the bent rod is ε' = B · L · v · √2/2.
The ratio of the induced EMFs is ε'/ε = √2/2.
